entry.title: Account bookmarks should be cleared when signing out
entry.content: After a user has opted-into butter, their account-bound bookmarks should be removed from the device after signing out.

entry.title: In-product help bubbles on new tab page steal focus from omnibox
entry.content: (I don't know exactly how to reproduce this because in-product help bubbles are non-deterministic.) I've noticed a couple times that I open the new tab page and start typing a URL. After I type a few characters, an in-product help bubble appears and steals focus, which is super annoying when I'm in the middle of typing a URL or search query. I just had this happen with the experimental AI features IPH, for example (https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/views/user_education/browser_user_education_service.cc;l=314;bpv=0;bpt=1).

entry.title: Update download_symbols.py to use versionhistory API
entry.content: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:tools/mac/download_symbols.py has been broken since omahaproxy was turned down. Chrome's PMs pointed to https://developer.chrome.com/docs/web-platform/versionhistory/guide as the replacement API.

entry.title: Investigate potential increased extension corruption
entry.content:
We've gotten reports of increased extension corruption lately. This is a tracking bug to investigate more.
Related issues: b/41486050, b/305454034 (internal).

entry.title: pixel_skia_gold_passthrough_test Pixel tests are flaky on Win bot due to renderer process hang
entry.content:
pixel_skia_gold_passthrough_test can fail due to renderer process hung
LUCI analysis: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/clusters/reason-v6/7407ce4a7f7049dec0c0cfa29ddf0576?selectedMetrics=human-cls-failed-presubmit%2Ccritical-failures-exonerated%2Cfailures%2Cbuilds-failed-due-to-flaky-tests&historyTimeRange=30d&annotated=false&tab=recent-failures
shows the pattern is pretty common
Example failing tests: Pixel_DirectComposition_Video_MP4 Pixel_Video_MP4_FourColors_Rot_180 Pixel_DirectComposition_Video_MP4_Fullsize
Example failing build: https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/ci/Win11%20FYI%20arm64%20Release%20%28Qualcomm%20Adreno%20690%29/b8755906138171023921

entry.title: Migrate UMA signals to SQL database
entry.content: The UMA signals from level db take a long time to query because of many post tasks needed for each model. Caching all signals and running batch processing causes memory regression for models. The faster way to store and query signals at once would be to use the SQL database to store and query signals instead.

entry.title: Same RGB colors are not equal when using @property <color> syntax (they should be)
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Use CSS @property to declare a custom property. Include the `syntax` descriptor with the `<color>` value. Assign a color with the `initial-value` descriptor using named color, hex, or rgb(). 2. Create a @container style query, including the custom property name without a value. 3. Update the custome property value to the hex, rgb(), named color, and hsl() equivalents. 4. Note that the container query returns false for the hex, rgb, and named color equivalents, but returns true fro the hsl() equivalent.
# Problem Description See https://codepen.io/estelle/pen/yLwZxPg which actually hilites 3 Chromium bugs that may be related to colors, @property, or container style queries, or a combination of those.
1. the first issue is that updating the custom property to a named color, 3-digit or 6-digit hex, or rgb() value using percents or integers are all equivalent. However, other syntaxes in the sRGB color space are not considered equal. For example, #f00 is equal to `#ff0000`, `red`, and `rgb(255 0 0)`, but not to `hsl(0 100% 50%)`, though it should be.
I am not sure if this is a container issue, style issue, color issue, or custom variable declaration (@property) issue.
The second issue is generated content within the style query. The generated content in a block where the style query in which the initial value is a match is always matched even if the custom variable has been updated. In the example codepen, the initial value set by @property is not applied to any element by default, so should not be a match. It is only applied via JS to the body element. There should be no container with the value of "red" (or green or blue), but the browser is behaving as if a container had that value, but just for generated content (it returning false for style(--theme) but true for style(--theme: red), but just for generated content. which makes no sense, since it is getting the non-pseudo-element stuff right.
the third issue shown in this codepen is an issue in Edge but not Chrome: Edge is allowing the assignment of non color values to the custom element. If you select the "choose your own color", change it to a valid color, say "purple", then remove a character so it's not longer a valid value, Google Chrome correctly identifies that the --theme value is still the original value (as there is no valid value set) whereas Microsoft Edge identifies the custom variable as having a value that is different from the initial value set in property; It may be allowing the custom variable to be assigned a non-color value (purpl), or it is not registering that the value is the original again. Either way, it's a bug.
# Additional Comments See https://codepen.io/estelle/pen/yLwZxPg. the example is showing the same issues when not in codepen format. When https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/32254 is merged, two of the three issues (not the generated content) will be live in MDN's "play" feature.
# Summary Same RGB colors are not equal when using @property <color> syntax (they should be)
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>CSS
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Details of interop issue Container style queries are only supported in Chrome and Edge (not FF or Safari) at the time of this writing.
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Users of `qr_code_generator` should provide a "quiet zone" around the QR code image
entry.content:
There may be 2 bugs in users/clients of `//components/qr_code_generator`:
* Some clients may not include a quiet zone around the QR code. - The spec requires a quiet zone of 4 modules ("a module" = a QR "pixel"; in the generated `SkBitmap` each QR "pixel" takes 10x10 "real pixels"). - AFAICT only `//chrome/browser/ui/views/qrcode_generator/qrcode_generator_bubble.cc` adds the quiet zone (see `QRCodeGeneratorBubble::AddQRCodeQuietZone`) - The quiet zone requirement can be found in https://www.qrcode.com/en/howto/code.html: "The QR Code symbol area requires a margin or "quiet zone" around it to be used." and "4-module wide margin is required around a symbol." - The QR code may be unreadable without the margin. For example, https://chrome-public-gold.skia.org/img/images/5d6570323185f6662b419e6284e935d6.png is rendered without the quiet zone margin and I was not able to open it using Google Lens on Android. (OTOH I heard that other people were able to open it on their iPhone.)
* The quiet zone may use a different "light color" than the rest of the QR code. In the long-term we probably want to make this configurable.

entry.title: Clank Flags: Main Path: Make Java flags a //base concept, not //chrome
Improve testing support for paint worklet driven animations.
entry.content:
See discussion on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5276967?tab=comments.
Currently, testing clip paths requires creating a mock clip path paint image generator. The only thing that is required for the generator is the paint worklet id, which makes its existence as a unique class somewhat questionable.
Additionally, it would be better if the test support for clip path animations could be done in a way that doesn't require explicitly initializing the mock on a per test basis.
It's also an open question how this issue applies to other paint worklet effects.

entry.title: Update TabSwitcherActionMenu tests to work with ANDROID_HUB enabled
Don't require consumers of BaseUIManager::IsAllowlisted to have to pass through an UnsafeResource
entry.content:
Some consumers of BaseUIManager::IsAllowlisted[1] create an UnsafeResource on the fly. This requires them to look at implementation details of that method to figure out which fields are needed.
Suggested approach to fix this is to have the method either list out all needed parameters directly, or have it call into a helper method that does so.
[1]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/safe_browsing/content/browser/base_ui_manager.cc;l=160;drc=f4a00cc248dd2dc8ec8759fb51620d47b5114090

entry.title: WebNN: Consolidate renderer-side code paths
entry.content:
The WebNN implementation contains lots of duplicated code.
For example, the "given these `MLNamedOperands` outputs, topologically sort and then build a graph" logic is nearly-duplicated in three places! Each of these implementations are subtly different - they all contain a mix of validation and build logic. The lack of modularization gives us less confidence that validation checks - such as those described in https://github.com/webmachinelearning/webnn/issues/572 - are applied consistently
With an eye towards improving maintainability and spec conformance, I think we should consider:
1. Making every `MLGraph` implementation consume a mojo `GraphInfo` struct - All backend-agnostic validation checks occur (synchronously) while calling `MLGraphBuilder` methods - Likewise, we should consider incrementally building this `GraphInfo` object rather than constructing it all at once in `build()`. But that may in part depend on whether an `MLGraphBuilder` can be re-used (https://github.com/webmachinelearning/webnn/issues/567) - `build()` throws this `GraphInfo` over the wall to the backend - Note that we need to move the TFLite converter to a utility process anyways (see issue 41494134) - That leaves the XNNPACK backend, which can either just use the `GraphInfo` object as a data structure (avoiding any IPC) or the renderer can hold both the remote and receiver ends of the mojo pipe. The benefit of the latter is allowing us give `MLGraph` a `HeapMojoRemote<webnn::mojom::blink::WebNNGraph>` on all platforms - All backend-specific validation checks occur (asynchronously) while the backend builds the backend-specific graph 1. Being consistent in how backend contexts are initialized. Currently: - the XNNPACK backend is initialized on `build()` - the //services backends are initialized when the `MLContext` is created 1. Having one `MLContext` implementation. Currently, things like `ExecutionContext` destruction are not handled consistently across implementations

entry.title: Ensure that java and native dep graphs do not intersect
entry.content:
Tried this a while ago: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4167404
We should have checks to ensure native targets do not depend on java ones, and vice versa. The deps do nothing, and reduce parallelism in the build graph.

entry.title: Use std::string_view for ClassMetaData data values that are static strings
entry.content: Using std::string_view is more efficient if the strings are static strings. For privacy concerns of collecting any metadata in UMA traces we will need to have static strings as well.

entry.title: oklch fallback color for chroma (way) outside the gamut changes the hue
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem Look at oklch(10% 0.5 86 )
# Problem Description The hue is in the red spectrum. It's correct for 100% down to about 15% and then shifts to green. It uses the nearest point in hue-chroma rather than just reducing the chroma and keeping the hue. This makes it harder to use dynamic color selection with a chroma value high enough to maximize the chroma for all possible hues.
# Summary oklch fallback color for chroma (way) outside the gamut changes the hue
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>CSS
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Details of interop issue undefined
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Dev \ Regression: No

entry.content:

# Problem Description either allow me to set user restrictions on device logon by ou or group membership.
The issue is that students are logging into staff devices which are on their own network with more lenient policies.
I am not going to manually list thousands and thousands of users by email to get this working. Your rep also stated wildcard functionality would not work for creatively excluding student emails (which have a different syntax than staff)
I could easily do this in AD in Windows.
# Summary I need a policy to restrict any user in a specific OU from logging into any chrome device in OU.
# Additional Data Category: Enterprise \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Adjusting the dynamic padding for QT carousel
entry.content: Currently, dynamic spacing in the query tile carousel clips the 'last visible' suggestion at 50%. This can sometimes create more padding between tiles than exists in the left and right margins. As we discussed, could we please adjust the dynamic spacing to clip the 'last visible' suggestion within a 30%-70% range to help us avoid cases where there is big spacing between tiles?

entry.title: Cleanup AutofillSuggestionGeneratorTest.AutofillCreditCardBenefitsLabelTest setup and parameters
Report an Issue... pops the allow capture dialog
entry.content: If Chromium doesnt have TCC permissions, it doesnt add a screenshot to the send feedback dialog. But if it does have permission, it does, but thats popping the macOS 14.4 beta dialog, which is weird. I did an audit of capture cases, and didnt find that, so thats a use that I missed.

entry.title: Clipped tiles are not visible with TalkBack enabled in the Query Tiles carousel
entry.content:
Bug--When using Query Tiles in a carousel on mobile with TalkBack enabled, I cannot swipe to view clipped tiles
Fix--When using Query Tiles in a carousel on mobile with TalkBack enabled, swiping to the right/left should allow you to see the clipped tiles

entry.title: Bling First Few Runs Gestural IPH v1.0 - UI Bugs
entry.content:
Link to implementation deck with specs: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1fJDe4OjB7SZeHbpcLTLk3bUMw2CUfw5aQ3RlkjtpmNQ/edit?pli=1&resourcekey=0-KTzrW2HZVWIsE4VomSxDig#slide=id.g269353b7910_0_246
[P2] The cursor of Swipe Back / Forward should begin at a position closer to the edge, since the gesture doesnt really work if you swipe from the middle of the screen. [P2] When in landscape, the IPH of Swipe Back / Forward is too close to the edge and thus hidden beneath the notch (dynamic island) [P2] When in landscape, the IPH of Swipe Right for Incognito is too close to the edge and thus hidden beneath the notch (dynamic island) [P2] For all IPHs, the colors should be updated when in dark mode [P2] The colors of Swipe Right for Incognito should be always in dark mode [P3] For all IPHs, the cursor should be less transparent (suggest to try 60% or 70% opacity). [P3] The style of the Dismiss button should be updated [P3] The IPH of Swipe Right for Incognito should be vertically centered on the screen. Right now its positioned too low and its too close to the cursor

entry.title: Dawn info collection no longer reports enabled toggles
entry.content:
This is a regression. Go to chrome://gpu/ and look in the "Dawn info" section.
On mac, 121.0.6167.160, you can see a list of toggle names in [Enabled Toggle Names] subsection.
In canary, 123.0.6304.0 the entire toggle section is blank. You see [Enabled Toggle Names], but nothing inside.
